DemoDays

Student demos at the intersection of art, design and code.

April 2012

Archival Content • Submit correction

The April 2012 DemoDays was held on 04/28/2012 at Pivotal Labs in New York City.

Join us next time!

DemoDays is a monthly student-run event in NYC, organized by tech@NYU, Parsons Code Club, Create@Cooper and Columbia ADI. We're all about fostering a community of students who create things. We want to provide a platform for student builders to present their work, to celebrate their creations, and let that inspire other students to build projects they care about.

  • Wanna show off?

    SIGN UP

  • Wanna hang out?

    RSVP

Demos

  • Oops, we don't have any data for this month yet. If you showed your work at DemoDays April 2012, please submit a correction!

Speaker

R. Luke Dubois

He's well known for his work with using algorithms to generate sound. Stochastic music, data mining, time-lapse phonography, L-systems, formal grammars - Luke does it all. His work has been featured at the Sundance Film Festival and the 2008 Democratic National Convention. He's also presented previously at Google, O'Reilly's Web 2.0 Expo, and the Guggenheim Museum.

Amit Pitaru

Amit Pitaru, our other speaker, is a coder and classically trained musician whose projects have ranged far and wide, including an incredible 3d synthesizer

DemoDays
